founders.name: Greg Smith
founders.bio_summary: Co-founder and CEO who began by building an LSAT course and custom online delivery that evolved into Thinkific.

founders.name: Matt Smith
founders.bio_summary: Co-founder who worked with Greg to build the first online course platform to reach more students than live teaching allowed.

founders.name: Miranda Lievers
founders.bio_summary: Co-founder who joined Greg and Matt to turn the initial LSAT course infrastructure into a scalable platform for course creators.

founders.name: Matt Payne
founders.bio_summary: Co-founder involved in early product development as Thinkific was formalized for broader creator use.

category: Learning commerce platform for courses, communities, memberships, and digital downloads
product_summary: Platform to build, market, and sell digital learning products—courses, communities, memberships, coaching, downloads—with payments and analytics under the creator’s own brand.
pricing: Basic $49/mo or $36/mo (billed annually), Start $99/mo or $74/mo annually, Grow $199/mo or $149/mo annually; all plans start with a 30-day free trial.

core_problem.statement: Creators needed a way to reach more students and control branding and revenue instead of relying on marketplaces or in-person classes.

competition.name: Teachable
competition.reason_compared: Direct competitor for creator-led online courses and digital products.

competition.name: Kajabi
competition.reason_compared: All-in-one platform for membership, coaching, and marketing automation targeting similar creators.

competition.name: Podia
competition.reason_compared: Lightweight platform for courses, downloads, and communities appealing to the same segment.

user_validation.detail: 50,000+ active customers and tens of millions of students per Q3 2024 press release.

market_background.insight: Creator-led education platforms are scaling globally; Thinkific reports $3.7B earned on-platform and 200M+ learners reached, showing substantial demand for owned learning commerce.

sources.note: Official about page with founder story and platform impact (35k customers, $3.7B earned, 200M+ learners).
Official pricing showing Basic/Start/Grow tiers, monthly and annual rates, and 30-day trial; reiterates customer/learner counts.
Q3 2024 financial results with $17.2M revenue, $58.0M ARR, and 50k+ active customers; confirms HQ in Vancouver.
Press page stating headquarters in Vancouver, BC and 165+ countries served.
BCBusiness profile noting Thinkific was co-founded by Greg Smith in 2012 in Vancouver.

feasibility.reason: Founder story, pricing, large-scale usage, and financial performance are documented with current primary sources.
